article.headline: Southern Miss 113, Spring Hill 57
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Demar Dotson scored 24 points and Southern Mississippi had six players in double figures Wednesday night during a 113-57 win over Spring Hill. The Golden Eagles (4-0) are off to their best start in four seasons, when they opened the 2002-03 season with five straight wins. Spring Hill (0-1) was led by Noah Woolridge's 21 points. It was the most points scored by Southern Miss since a 122-112 win over Wyoming in 1990 and the most points at home since a 127-102 win over Virginia Tech in 1988. Southern Mississippi used a 26-3 run over the final nine minutes of the first half to break open a close game and take a commanding 45-22 lead into halftime. Southern Miss' 7-foot center, Gjio Bain, had 11 points and nine rebounds in the half and completed the deciding run with back-to-back slam dunks. Jeremy Wise added 18 for the Golden Eagles and Dwayne Green had 12. Courtney Beasley scored 12, Bain 11 and Andre Stephens chipped in 10. Bain had a game-high 14 rebounds.
